article.title: Transient Survey Rates for Orphan Afterglows from Compact Merger Jets

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 1 depicts the number of afterglow transients, brighter than a given r-band magnitude, expected from different merger jet models.  Which line style represents the results for homogeneous jet models with a fixed initial Lorentz factor (WP15)?
choices: Thin blue dotted line and Thick pink dotted line
Thick red solid line and Medium thickness solid cyan line
Thin black dashed-dotted line, Black solid line, and Thin black dotted line

multiple_choice_question.text: Table 1 presents the predicted rates of afterglow transients for different merger jet models and survey telescopes. What is the approximate range for the combined rate of GRB and orphan afterglows detectable by LSST, considering all models and a limiting r-band magnitude of 24.5?
Figure 2 illustrates how the peak r-band magnitude of an afterglow changes with the observer\'s inclination angle relative to the jet axis. What does the yellow star on each blue line represent?
choices: The peak r-band magnitude of the afterglow
The time (in days) after the merger when the afterglow reaches peak flux
The isotropic equivalent energy of the jet

multiple_choice_question.text: The article discusses the challenge of differentiating between orphan afterglows from merger jets and those from long GRB progenitors. What characteristic of short GRB host galaxies is mentioned as a potential distinguishing factor?
